verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, and Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, concerning what he saw as it relates to Samaria and Jerusalem.
parts: The word of the Lord came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, and Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, concerning what he saw as it relates to Samaria and Jerusalem.

verses.text: Hear these words, O people!
parts: Hear these words, O people!

verses.text: For behold, the Lord is coming out of His place.
parts: For behold, the Lord is coming out of His place.

verses.text: The mountains will shake under Him, and the valleys will melt like wax before the fire, like water pouring down a steep incline.
parts: The mountains will shake under Him, and the valleys will melt like wax before the fire, like water pouring down a steep incline.

verses.text: All of this is for the transgression of Jacob and the sin of the house of Israel.
parts: All of this is for the transgression of Jacob and the sin of the house of Israel.

verses.text: “I will make Samaria become as a shed in the field and a vineyard for planting, and I will tear down her stones in confusion and expose her foundations. And they shall cut all of her carved images into pieces and burn down all her houses of prostitution with fire.
parts: “I will make Samaria become as a shed in the field and a vineyard for planting, and I will tear down her stones in confusion and expose her foundations.
And they shall cut all of her carved images into pieces and burn down all her houses of prostitution with fire.

verses.text: And they shall cut all of her carved images into pieces and burn down all her houses of prostitution with fire.
parts: And they shall cut all of her carved images into pieces and burn down all her houses of prostitution with fire.

verses.text: On account of this she will wail and lament.
parts: On account of this she will wail and lament.

verses.text: For her calamity overwhelms her, for it has come to Judah, as far as to the gate of My people—to Jerusalem.
parts: For her calamity overwhelms her, for it has come to Judah, as far as to the gate of My people—to Jerusalem.

verses.text: Those of Gath, do not exalt yourselves, and those of the house of Aphrah, do not rebuild your house from laughter; sprinkle dust on your laughter.
parts: Those of Gath, do not exalt yourselves, and those of the house of Aphrah, do not rebuild your house from laughter; sprinkle dust on your laughter.

verses.text: The one living in Shaphir, dwelling comfortably in her cities, did not come to mourn her neighbor; she will receive a calamity of grief from you.
parts: The one living in Shaphir, dwelling comfortably in her cities, did not come to mourn her neighbor; she will receive a calamity of grief from you.

verses.text: Who has begun to do good for her who dwells in distress?
parts: Who has begun to do good for her who dwells in distress?

verses.text: even the sound of a chariot and horseman.
parts: even the sound of a chariot and horseman.

verses.text: Because of this He will cause men to be sent forth as far as the inheritance of Gath, vain houses, for they have become vanity to the kings of Israel,
parts: Because of this He will cause men to be sent forth as far as the inheritance of Gath, vain houses, for they have become vanity to the kings of Israel,

verses.text: until they bring the heirs to you, O inhabitants of Lachish; the inheritance shall come as far as Adullam, even the glory of the daughter of Israel.
parts: until they bring the heirs to you, O inhabitants of Lachish; the inheritance shall come as far as Adullam, even the glory of the daughter of Israel.

verses.text: Shave your hair and make your head bald as an eagle for the sake of your precious children; increase your widowhood, for they have been taken captive.
parts: Shave your hair and make your head bald as an eagle for the sake of your precious children; increase your widowhood, for they have been taken captive.

headers: The Lord Has a Case against Israel

verses.text: They devised wickedness and were scheming evil on their beds, and at daybreak they put their plan into action, for they did not lift up their hands to God. They coveted fields and plundered orphans; they oppressed families and plundered a man and his house, a man and his inheritance.
parts: They devised wickedness and were scheming evil on their beds, and at daybreak they put their plan into action, for they did not lift up their hands to God.
They coveted fields and plundered orphans; they oppressed families and plundered a man and his house, a man and his inheritance.

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am devising evils against this tribe from which you shall not lift up your neck, nor will you suddenly walk upright, for this is a time of evil.
parts: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am devising evils against this tribe from which you shall not lift up your neck, nor will you suddenly walk upright, for this is a time of evil.

verses.text: In that day a parable shall be taken up against you, and a dirge will be wailed, saying, ‘In misery we have suffered hardship.
parts: In that day a parable shall be taken up against you, and a dirge will be wailed, saying, ‘In misery we have suffered hardship.

verses.text: Therefore there will be no one to put out a measuring line for a lot for you in the assembly of the Lord.
parts: Therefore there will be no one to put out a measuring line for a lot for you in the assembly of the Lord.

verses.text: “Do not shed tears, nor even weep over these things; for He will not dismiss the reproaches who says, ‘The house of Jacob has provoked the Spirit of the Lord; are these not His practices?
parts: “Do not shed tears, nor even weep over these things; for He will not dismiss the reproaches who says, ‘The house of Jacob has provoked the Spirit of the Lord; are these not His practices?

verses.text: who says, ‘The house of Jacob has provoked the Spirit of the Lord; are these not His practices?
parts: who says, ‘The house of Jacob has provoked the Spirit of the Lord; are these not His practices?

verses.text: And previously, for enmity my people resisted against His peace.
parts: And previously, for enmity my people resisted against His peace.

verses.text: Therefore those leading my people will be cast out of their luxurious homes; they have been driven out because of their wicked practices.
parts: Therefore those leading my people will be cast out of their luxurious homes; they have been driven out because of their wicked practices.

verses.text: Arise and depart, for this is not a final resting place for you on account of uncleanness; you have been utterly destroyed by corruption.
parts: Arise and depart, for this is not a final resting place for you on account of uncleanness; you have been utterly destroyed by corruption.

verses.text: You were pursued by no one pursuing!
parts: You were pursued by no one pursuing!

verses.text: “Jacob will be completely gathered together with all of them.
parts: “Jacob will be completely gathered together with all of them.

verses.text: They will break through the gate of captivity, and their king comes out before their presence.
parts: They will break through the gate of captivity, and their king comes out before their presence.

verses.text: He will say, “Hear these things, O heads of the house of Jacob, and you remnant of Israel.
parts: He will say, “Hear these things, O heads of the house of Jacob, and you remnant of Israel.

verses.text: you who hate good and love evil; you who seize their skins in order flay them and cut their flesh off their bones?
parts: you who hate good and love evil; you who seize their skins in order flay them and cut their flesh off their bones?

verses.text: who devoured the flesh of my people by removing their skin, breaking their bones, and dividing them as merely flesh for the cauldron and as meat for the pot?”
parts: who devoured the flesh of my people by removing their skin, breaking their bones, and dividing them as merely flesh for the cauldron and as meat for the pot?”

verses.text: Thus they will cry out to the Lord, but He will not hear them.
parts: Thus they will cry out to the Lord, but He will not hear them.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord concerning the prophets who lead my people astray, who were proclaiming peace upon them while they themselves ate, but who, when nothing was put in their mouths, stirred up war against them: “Therefore to you there will be darkness instead of vision, and to you there will be darkness instead of prophecy.
parts: Thus says the Lord concerning the prophets who lead my people astray, who were proclaiming peace upon them while they themselves ate, but who, when nothing was put in their mouths, stirred up war against them: “Therefore to you there will be darkness instead of vision, and to you there will be darkness instead of prophecy.

verses.text: “Therefore to you there will be darkness instead of vision, and to you there will be darkness instead of prophecy.
parts: “Therefore to you there will be darkness instead of vision, and to you there will be darkness instead of prophecy.

verses.text: And the seers of dreams will be put to shame, and the prophets will be laughed to scorn.
parts: And the seers of dreams will be put to shame, and the prophets will be laughed to scorn.

verses.text: Surely I shall strengthen myself in the Spirit of the Lord, and of judgment, and of power, to proclaim to Jacob his ungodliness and to Israel his sins. Indeed, hear this, you heads of the house of Jacob and the remnant of the house of Israel, you who despise judgment and are perverting everything that is upright, who build up Zion with bloodshed and Jerusalem with injustice.
parts: Surely I shall strengthen myself in the Spirit of the Lord, and of judgment, and of power, to proclaim to Jacob his ungodliness and to Israel his sins.

Indeed, hear this, you heads of the house of Jacob and the remnant of the house of Israel, you who despise judgment and are perverting everything that is upright, who build up Zion with bloodshed and Jerusalem with injustice.

verses.text: Indeed, hear this, you heads of the house of Jacob and the remnant of the house of Israel, you who despise judgment and are perverting everything that is upright,
parts: Indeed, hear this, you heads of the house of Jacob and the remnant of the house of Israel, you who despise judgment and are perverting everything that is upright,

verses.text: who build up Zion with bloodshed and Jerusalem with injustice.
parts: who build up Zion with bloodshed and Jerusalem with injustice.

verses.text: Her leaders make decisions founded on a bribe, and her priests give answers for pay, and her prophets prophesy for money.
parts: Her leaders make decisions founded on a bribe, and her priests give answers for pay, and her prophets prophesy for money.

verses.text: Therefore on account of you, Zion shall be plowed as a field; Jerusalem shall be as a shed in the field, and the mountain of the house as a grove of trees.
parts: Therefore on account of you, Zion shall be plowed as a field; Jerusalem shall be as a shed in the field, and the mountain of the house as a grove of trees.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in the last days that the mountain of the Lord will be revealed.
parts: And it shall come to pass in the last days that the mountain of the Lord will be revealed.

verses.text: And many nations will go there and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob.
parts: And many nations will go there and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob.

verses.text: And He will judge between many peoples and rebuke strong nations afar off.
parts: And He will judge between many peoples and rebuke strong nations afar off.

verses.text: But everyone shall be at rest under his own vine and under his own fig tree, and no one shall make them afraid, for the mouth of the Lord Almighty has spoken these things.
parts: But everyone shall be at rest under his own vine and under his own fig tree, and no one shall make them afraid, for the mouth of the Lord Almighty has spoken these things.

verses.text: For all the peoples shall walk each one his own way, but we will walk in the name of the Lord our God for ever and ever.
parts: For all the peoples shall walk each one his own way, but we will walk in the name of the Lord our God for ever and ever.

verses.text: “In that day,” says the Lord, “I shall gather her who has been broken, and I will welcome her who has been exiled, even those whom I have rejected. And I shall make her who has been broken into a remnant, and her that was rejected into a strong nation.
parts: “In that day,” says the Lord, “I shall gather her who has been broken, and I will welcome her who has been exiled, even those whom I have rejected.
And I shall make her who has been broken into a remnant, and her that was rejected into a strong nation.

verses.text: And I shall make her who has been broken into a remnant, and her that was rejected into a strong nation.
parts: And I shall make her who has been broken into a remnant, and her that was rejected into a strong nation.

verses.text: And you, O daughter of Zion, dark tower of the flock, on you it will come and enter in, even the former kingdom of Babylon to the daughter of Jerusalem.”
parts: And you, O daughter of Zion, dark tower of the flock, on you it will come and enter in, even the former kingdom of Babylon to the daughter of Jerusalem.”

verses.text: And now, why have you experienced such evils?
parts: And now, why have you experienced such evils?

verses.text: Suffer birth pains and take courage, O daughter of Zion, and draw near like a woman giving birth; for now you will be exiled from the city, and you will abide in the flat open country, and you will have come as far off as Babylon; and from that place the Lord your God shall redeem you from the hand of your enemies.
parts: Suffer birth pains and take courage, O daughter of Zion, and draw near like a woman giving birth; for now you will be exiled from the city, and you will abide in the flat open country, and you will have come as far off as Babylon; and from that place the Lord your God shall redeem you from the hand of your enemies.

verses.text: Now many nations have gathered against you, saying, “We will rejoice, and our eyes will gaze upon Zion.” But they do not know the thoughts of the Lord nor perceive His counsel, for He gathered them like sheaves for the threshing floor.
parts: Now many nations have gathered against you, saying, “We will rejoice, and our eyes will gaze upon Zion.” But they do not know the thoughts of the Lord nor perceive His counsel, for He gathered them like sheaves for the threshing floor.

verses.text: But they do not know the thoughts of the Lord nor perceive His counsel, for He gathered them like sheaves for the threshing floor.
parts: But they do not know the thoughts of the Lord nor perceive His counsel, for He gathered them like sheaves for the threshing floor.

verses.text: “Arise and thresh them, O daughter of Zion, for I shall make your horns iron, and I will make your hooves bronze.
parts: “Arise and thresh them, O daughter of Zion, for I shall make your horns iron, and I will make your hooves bronze.

verses.text: Now the daughter of Ephraim will be blockaded by a siege wall; for he ordered affliction against us, and they shall smite the tribes of Israel with a rod upon the cheek.”
parts: Now the daughter of Ephraim will be blockaded by a siege wall; for he ordered affliction against us, and they shall smite the tribes of Israel with a rod upon the cheek.”

verses.text: “And you, O Bethlehem, House of Ephrathah, though you are fewest in number among the thousands of Judah, yet out of you shall come forth to me the One to be ruler of Israel.
parts: “And you, O Bethlehem, House of Ephrathah, though you are fewest in number among the thousands of Judah, yet out of you shall come forth to me the One to be ruler of Israel.

verses.text: Therefore He shall give them up until the appointed time for her to give birth, and then the remnant of their brothers will return to the sons of Israel.
parts: Therefore He shall give them up until the appointed time for her to give birth, and then the remnant of their brothers will return to the sons of Israel.

verses.text: And He shall stand and see, and shepherd His flock in the strength of the Lord, and they will dwell in the glory of the name of the Lord their God, for now they will be magnified unto the ends of the earth.
parts: And He shall stand and see, and shepherd His flock in the strength of the Lord, and they will dwell in the glory of the name of the Lord their God, for now they will be magnified unto the ends of the earth.

verses.text: And she will have peace; for when the Assyrian comes into our land and goes up upon our country, then seven shepherds and eight attacks from men will be raised up against them.
parts: And she will have peace; for when the Assyrian comes into our land and goes up upon our country, then seven shepherds and eight attacks from men will be raised up against them.

verses.text: They will tend the Assyrian with a sword and the land of Nimrod in her trench.
parts: They will tend the Assyrian with a sword and the land of Nimrod in her trench.

verses.text: And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as dew falling from the Lord and as lambs in a field of grass, in order that none among the sons of men may assemble together nor resist.
parts: And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as dew falling from the Lord and as lambs in a field of grass, in order that none among the sons of men may assemble together nor resist.

verses.text: And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as a lion among the cattle in the forest, and as a young lion among a flock of sheep, which, whenever it passes through, seizes and carries off its prey, and there is none to rescue.
parts: And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as a lion among the cattle in the forest, and as a young lion among a flock of sheep, which, whenever it passes through, seizes and carries off its prey, and there is none to rescue.

verses.text: But your hand will be exalted above those oppressing you, and all your enemies will be completely cut off.
parts: But your hand will be exalted above those oppressing you, and all your enemies will be completely cut off.

verses.text: “And it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord, “I shall utterly destroy your horses from your midst and destroy your chariots.
parts: “And it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord, “I shall utterly destroy your horses from your midst and destroy your chariots.

verses.text: I shall utterly destroy the cities of your land and demolish all your strongholds.
parts: I shall utterly destroy the cities of your land and demolish all your strongholds.

verses.text: And I shall drive away your sorceries out of your hands, and there shall be no soothsayers among you.
parts: And I shall drive away your sorceries out of your hands, and there shall be no soothsayers among you.

verses.text: I shall utterly destroy your carved images and the sacred pillars from your midst, and you will no longer worship the work of your hands;
parts: I shall utterly destroy your carved images and the sacred pillars from your midst, and you will no longer worship the work of your hands;

verses.text: and I shall cut off your sacred groves from your midst and destroy your cities.
parts: and I shall cut off your sacred groves from your midst and destroy your cities.

verses.text: And I shall exact vengeance on the nations with wrath and anger among those who did not heed.”
parts: And I shall exact vengeance on the nations with wrath and anger among those who did not heed.”

verses.text: Now hear the word of the Lord.
parts: Now hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: Hear, O mountains, the judgment of the Lord, and you valleys, the foundations of the earth; for the Lord has a case against His people, and He will contend with Israel.
parts: Hear, O mountains, the judgment of the Lord, and you valleys, the foundations of the earth; for the Lord has a case against His people, and He will contend with Israel.

verses.text: O My people, what have I done to you?
parts: O My people, what have I done to you?

verses.text: For I brought you up from the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of bondage; and I sent you Moses, and Aaron, and Miriam.
parts: For I brought you up from the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of bondage; and I sent you Moses, and Aaron, and Miriam.

verses.text: O My people, remember now what King Balak of Moab plotted against you, and what answer Balaam the son of Beor gave to him from the reeds as far as to Gilgal, that the righteousness of the Lord might be known.”
parts: O My people, remember now what King Balak of Moab plotted against you, and what answer Balaam the son of Beor gave to him from the reeds as far as to Gilgal, that the righteousness of the Lord might be known.”

verses.text: How shall I come to understand the Lord and devote myself to the Most High God?
parts: How shall I come to understand the Lord and devote myself to the Most High God?

verses.text: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams?
parts: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams?

verses.text: He has shown you, O man, what is good.
parts: He has shown you, O man, what is good.

verses.text: The Lord's voice shall be proclaimed in the city, and He shall save those who fear His name.
parts: The Lord's voice shall be proclaimed in the city, and He shall save those who fear His name.

verses.text: For is there not a fire there, and the house of the lawless storing up lawless treasures with insolent unrighteousness?
parts: For is there not a fire there, and the house of the lawless storing up lawless treasures with insolent unrighteousness?

verses.text: Will the lawless be justified by a balance scale or a bag of deceitful weights
parts: Will the lawless be justified by a balance scale or a bag of deceitful weights

verses.text: from which they accumulated their ungodly wealth?
parts: from which they accumulated their ungodly wealth?

verses.text: “Therefore I will begin to smite you; I will destroy you because of your sins.
parts: “Therefore I will begin to smite you; I will destroy you because of your sins.

verses.text: You shall eat but not be satisfied, and there will be darkness upon you, and he will depart without being noticed, and you will not be rescued; and all who do escape will be given over to the sword.
parts: You shall eat but not be satisfied, and there will be darkness upon you, and he will depart without being noticed, and you will not be rescued; and all who do escape will be given over to the sword.

verses.text: You will sow, but you will not reap.
parts: You will sow, but you will not reap.

verses.text: For you have kept the ordinances of Omri and done all the works of the house of Ahab.
parts: For you have kept the ordinances of Omri and done all the works of the house of Ahab.

verses.text: Woe is me!
parts: Woe is me!

verses.text: For the God-fearing man has perished from the earth, and there is no one upright among the men.
parts: For the God-fearing man has perished from the earth, and there is no one upright among the men.

verses.text: They prepare their hands for evil; the prince demands a gift, and the judge speaks flattering words; it is the desire of their soul.
parts: They prepare their hands for evil; the prince demands a gift, and the judge speaks flattering words; it is the desire of their soul.

verses.text: their good things as the moth who eats away, and as one proceeding by the rule in the day of the watch.
parts: their good things as the moth who eats away, and as one proceeding by the rule in the day of the watch.

verses.text: Do not trust in friends, nor put your hope in those who govern.
parts: Do not trust in friends, nor put your hope in those who govern.

verses.text: For a son dishonors his father, a daughter will rise up against her mother, a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; a man's enemies are all the people of his own house.”
parts: For a son dishonors his father, a daughter will rise up against her mother, a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; a man's enemies are all the people of his own house.”

verses.text: But I will look to the Lord.
parts: But I will look to the Lord.

verses.text: Do not rejoice over me, O my enemy, for though I have fallen, yet will I arise, because even if I should sit in darkness, the Lord will be a light to me.
parts: Do not rejoice over me, O my enemy, for though I have fallen, yet will I arise, because even if I should sit in darkness, the Lord will be a light to me.

verses.text: I will endure the wrath of the Lord, for I sinned against Him, until He pleads my cause; for He will execute my judgment and will bring me out into the light, and I will perceive His righteousness.
parts: I will endure the wrath of the Lord, for I sinned against Him, until He pleads my cause; for He will execute my judgment and will bring me out into the light, and I will perceive His righteousness.

verses.text: And my enemy will see it, and he who says to me, “Where is the Lord your God?” will be clothed with shame.
parts: And my enemy will see it, and he who says to me, “Where is the Lord your God?” will be clothed with shame.

verses.text: In the days when your bricks are being plastered—that day will be your destruction, and your ordinances will be abolished.
parts: In the days when your bricks are being plastered—that day will be your destruction, and your ordinances will be abolished.

verses.text: In that day even your cities will be leveled to the ground and divided among the Assyrians; your fortified cities will be divided from Tyre as far as the River of Syria; it will be a day of flood and chaos.
parts: In that day even your cities will be leveled to the ground and divided among the Assyrians; your fortified cities will be divided from Tyre as far as the River of Syria; it will be a day of flood and chaos.

verses.text: And the land will become totally desolate together with those dwelling in it, because of the fruit of their practices.
parts: And the land will become totally desolate together with those dwelling in it, because of the fruit of their practices.

verses.text: Shepherd Your people with Your staff, the sheep of Your inheritance, those dwelling solitarily in the thicket in the midst of Carmel.
parts: Shepherd Your people with Your staff, the sheep of Your inheritance, those dwelling solitarily in the thicket in the midst of Carmel.

verses.text: And as in the days of your departure from the land of Egypt, you will see many wonders.
parts: And as in the days of your departure from the land of Egypt, you will see many wonders.

verses.text: The Gentiles will see and be ashamed of all their might.
parts: The Gentiles will see and be ashamed of all their might.

verses.text: They shall lick the dust like serpents crawling on the earth; they will be confounded in their confinement and be amazed at the Lord our God, and they will be afraid of You.
parts: They shall lick the dust like serpents crawling on the earth; they will be confounded in their confinement and be amazed at the Lord our God, and they will be afraid of You.

verses.text: Who is a God like You, removing wrongdoings and passing over the ungodliness of the remnant of His inheritance?
parts: Who is a God like You, removing wrongdoings and passing over the ungodliness of the remnant of His inheritance?

verses.text: He will return and have compassion on us.
parts: He will return and have compassion on us.

verses.text: You will give truthfulness to Jacob and mercy to Abraham, as You swore to our ancestors from days of old.
parts: You will give truthfulness to Jacob and mercy to Abraham, as You swore to our ancestors from days of old.
